61.meaning: The power of inner sincerity and truth that can influence even the most unlikely subjects. This hexagram represents the magnetic force of genuine authenticity that creates trust and understanding. Like wind over a lake, inner truth creates gentle but profound influence.
61.divination: Cultivate inner sincerity and truth. Authentic communication can reach anyone. Trust in the power of genuine honesty and openness.

changing_lines.1: Being prepared brings good fortune. If there are secret designs, it is disquieting.
changing_lines.2: A crane calling in the shade. Its young answers it. I have a good goblet. I will share it with you.
changing_lines.3: He finds a companion. Now he beats the drum, now he stops. Now he sobs, now he sings.
changing_lines.4: The moon nearly at the full. The team horse goes astray. No blame.
changing_lines.5: He possesses truth, which links together. No blame.
changing_lines.6: Cockcrow penetrating to heaven. Perseverance brings misfortune.

62.name: Preponderance of the Small
62.judgment: Preponderance of the Small. Success. Perseverance furthers. Small things may be done; great things should not be done.
62.image: Thunder on the mountain: the image of Preponderance of the Small. Thus in his conduct the superior man gives preponderance to reverence. In bereavement he gives preponderance to grief. In his expenditures he gives preponderance to thrift.
62.meaning: A time when small, careful actions are more appropriate than grand gestures. This hexagram emphasizes the importance of attention to detail and modest behavior. Like thunder echoing in mountains, small actions can have significant effects when properly applied.
62.divination: Focus on small, careful actions rather than grand plans. Pay attention to details and act with modesty. Success comes through careful, measured steps.

changing_lines.1: A bird in flight brings misfortune.
changing_lines.2: She passes by her ancestor and meets her ancestress. He does not reach his prince and meets his official. No blame.
changing_lines.3: If one is not extremely careful, somebody may come up from behind and strike him. Misfortune.
changing_lines.4: No blame. He meets him without passing by. Going brings danger. One must be on guard. Do not act. Be constantly persevering.
changing_lines.5: Dense clouds, no rain from our western region. The prince shoots and hits him who is in the cave.
changing_lines.6: He passes him by, not meeting him. The bird flies away. Misfortune. This means bad luck and injury.

63.name: After Completion
63.judgment: After Completion. Success in small matters. Perseverance furthers. At the beginning good fortune, at the end disorder.
63.image: Water over fire: the image of the condition after completion. Thus the superior man takes thought of misfortune and arms himself against it in advance.
63.meaning: The state after achieving completion or success, when vigilance is needed to maintain what has been accomplished. This hexagram warns that completion brings its own challenges and the need for continued attention. Like water over fire, balance must be carefully maintained.
63.divination: Success has been achieved, but remain vigilant. Completion brings new challenges. Maintain what you have accomplished through continued careful attention.

changing_lines.1: He brakes his wheels. Wets his tail. No blame.
changing_lines.2: The woman loses the curtain of her carriage. Do not run after it; on the seventh day you will get it.
changing_lines.3: The Illustrious Ancestor disciplines the Devil's Country. After three years he conquers it. Inferior people must not be employed.
changing_lines.4: The finest clothes turn to rags. Be careful all day long.
changing_lines.5: The neighbor in the east who slaughters an ox does not attain as much real happiness as the neighbor in the west with his small offering.
changing_lines.6: He gets his head in the water. Danger.

64.name: Before Completion
64.judgment: Before Completion. Success. But if the little fox, after nearly completing the crossing, gets his tail in the water, there is nothing that would further.
64.image: Fire over water: the image of the condition before completion. Thus the superior man is careful in the differentiation of things, so that each finds its place.
64.meaning: The state before completion when careful progress is needed to achieve success. This hexagram represents the delicate final phase of any endeavor when success is within reach but not yet secured. Like fire over water, the elements are not yet in harmony.
64.divination: Success is within reach but not yet achieved. Proceed carefully and avoid premature celebration. Complete your efforts with the same care you began them.

changing_lines.1: He gets his tail in the water. Humiliating.
changing_lines.2: He brakes his wheels. Perseverance brings good fortune.
changing_lines.3: Before completion, attack brings misfortune. It furthers one to cross the great water.
changing_lines.4: Perseverance brings good fortune. Remorse disappears. Shock, in order to subdue the Devil's Country. For three years, great realms are awarded.
changing_lines.5: Perseverance brings good fortune. No remorse. The light of the superior man is true. Good fortune.
changing_lines.6: There is drinking of wine in genuine confidence. No blame. But if one wets his head, he loses it, in truth.

coins.name: Three Coins Method
coins.description: Traditional method using three coins, tossed six times
